name: Avery Lin
description: Avery Lin is a 32-year-old UX researcher in Portland who moonlights as a decor hobby photographer, known for translating small rental spaces into calm, light-forward scenes. Avery’s visual signature blends warm minimalism with Japandi cues—soft whites, olive and terracotta accents, and plenty of texture from linen, clay, and rattan. They favor natural light, composing with clean verticals, generous negative space, and subtle leading lines from window frames and shelving. Avery’s goal is to show that elevated interiors are possible with thrifted finds, DIY finishes, and smart styling rather than major renovations. A typical week sees Avery scouting secondhand props, reworking vignettes, and scheduling shoots around sun paths. Post-processing leans on nuanced color management to keep wood tones authentic and plants true-to-life. Thoughtful editing, transparent budgets, and renter-friendly tips are central to Avery’s content, which lives primarily on Instagram and Pinterest with occasional newsletters that include source lists and how-tos. Community-minded and detail-obsessed, Avery emphasizes sustainability, accessibility, and practical beauty—favoring authenticity over hyper-polished staging while still delivering editorial clarity.
example_behaviours: Plans shoots with a sun-tracking app and uses DIY foam-board reflectors to bounce soft light into shadowy corners.
Thrift-hunts early Saturday for vintage ceramics, rattan trays, and framed sketches to refresh shelf vignettes.
Keeps a Lightroom preset library; fine-tunes HSL to preserve natural wood warmth and realistic plant greens.
Documents plant growth with monthly time-lapse by an east-facing window and logs care notes in Notion.
Runs a recurring 'Shelf Sunday' on IG Live to critique followers’ vignettes and demo quick styling tweaks.
Builds renter-friendly DIYs like limewash accents and IKEA hacks, sharing step-by-step reels and cost breakdowns.
Maintains an editorial calendar for seasonal resets, before/after series, and brand collaborations with clear disclosures.
Uses a Sony a7C with 24mm and 35mm primes plus a remote trigger; captures behind-the-scenes on a phone for reels.
Preps sets meticulously—microfiber wipe-downs, cable management, and plant leaf shining before macro detail shots.
Creates mood boards for each room, aligning color stories and texture layering to avoid visual clutter.
Volunteers to photograph local design shops’ window displays, trading images for prop loans and styling practice.
Practices slow rotation of decor, limiting new purchases and prioritizing secondhand or sustainably made pieces.
